div.div: ἀλαλητός (cf. ἀλαλάζω, and for the reduplication also ὀλολύζω, ἐλελεῦ, etc.): loud, resounding yell, yelling, war-cry, of a tumultuous throng; usually a triumphant outcry, but raised by the panic-stricken victims of Achilles, Il. 21.10; in the assembly, by a majority opposed to fighting, Od. 24.463.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
